An email that we received and we want to share with our school family! "Personal data from over 240 million Facebook users was leaked and has now made its way onto the dark web for sale. Assume that your data was leaked, and no, there isn't anything you can do about it. The data didn't include passwords but did include name, phone, email, fb profile ID. This data will be used for phishing. I just received a text from "Compass Bank" asking me to reset account info. I don't use compass, so it is an easy delete, but it could be confusing if the text purported to come from my actual bank.

Please be vigilant and remember that your bank/Microsoft/Apple/etc... will not contact you via text or email to "validate" your account. If you think that your bank is legitimately trying to reach you, go to the bank website directly or call them. Do not follow links in a text or email."

I hope this information can help to spare you and your users from any of these Phishing attempts.

Lock Your Meds® encourages people to secure and take regular inventory of their medication so it doesn't fall into the wrong hands. Many adults may be unintentional suppliers and awareness is the key to ending this preventable epidemic.
